result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel R Kram was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child
Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child
Sex with Child Age 16 or Older

supervisions.notes: Restitution in the amount of $487.00 is to be paid to Christine F by 12/17/2025, DOC is to collect up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment. Restitution is to be paid before all other costs.

Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 9/17/2061, DOC is to collect up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 9/17/2061, DOC is to collect up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to:  (to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison), consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 8 days time served.

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
No contact with SRF. Court advised the defendant of the penalties if this order is violated.

per order dated August 31, 2016, Appeal 2016XX704CR on cases 15CF1536, 15CF2493, and 15CF2675, the State Public Defender shall have thirty days from the date of this order to appoint postconviction counsel for Kram and to order transcripts. The State Public Defender's report is accepted as filed.

per order dated August 18, 2016, Appeal 2016XX704CR, the motion to extend the deadline for appointment of counsel and ordering transcripts shall be held in abeyance until further notice of this court. The question of Kram's eligibility for appointed postconviction representation is hereby referred to the office of the State Public Defender. The State Public Defender shall have fifteen days from the date of this order to file a report addresing Kram's eligibilty for appointed counsel and to advise whether the State Public Defender believes it requires an extension of its deadlines in this matter.

per order dated May 12, 2016, Appeal 2016XX704CR on cases 15CF1536, 15CF2493, and 15CF2675, the time for appointing counsel and ordering transcripts is extended until thirty days from the date of this order.

Defendant Daniel R Kram in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Defendant Daniel R Kram in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Correction made to the cover page of the PSI.
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Rebecca K., S.K., Christine F., S.R.F., Mary W.

  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 9 months in the House of Correction (to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison), consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 8 days time served.  
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 9/17/2061, DOC is to collect up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 9/17/2061DOC is to collect up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution in the amount of $487.00 is to be paid to Christine F by 12/17/2025, DOC is to collect up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment. Restitution is to be paid before all other costs.
-No contact with SRF. Court advised the defendant of the penalties if this order is violated.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Defendant Daniel R Kram in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Defendant Daniel R Kram in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
AS TO COUNT 5:
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised the defendant that he may be subject to the sex offender registry and must comply with the sex offender reporting requirements. Court ordered a Presentence Report at the State's Request. Case calendared for SENTENCING in Branch 15. Court released the jury panel and the exhibits were withdrawn.
AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, 3 and 4:
  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered Counts 1, 2, 3 and 4 DISMISSED and READ IN.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

$10,000.00 cash to Atty Jonathan Smith per assignment of bail filed July 23, 2015.

Defendant Daniel R Kram in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Defendant Daniel R Kram in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
As this court is rotating to another calendar, the motion for in-camera inspection filed by the defense would be best suited to be heard by the trial court that will be presiding, Branch 15.  The state has filed a motion for joinder of cases (15CF1536/15CF2493/15CF2675) which is to be heard on August 12 at 8:30.  The court will put all matters over to that date for hearing.
Defense counsel is moving the court to allow that the defendant be granted video conferencing access in the jail for purposes of meeting with his family, the state has no objection and the court will grant the request.
Defense counsel is requesting that the cash bail that has been posted in cases 15CF1536 ($50,000) and in 15CF2493 ($10,000) be returned to the parties which posted it as the defendant is sitting on $100,000 cash in 15CF2675 and is unable to post.
Atty Smith is requesting that from the bail returned a bail assignment in the amount of $10,000 be allowed.  The state opposes any return of bail or bail assignment.
THE COURT ORDERS THAT $10,000.00 cash be assigned and returned to Atty Jonathan Smith in 15CF1536 per Bail Assignment on file.  All other conditions and bail to remain.

Bail assignment signed by Mary Walker.

Defendant Daniel R Kram in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Defendant Daniel R Kram in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  There is a joint request to adjourn the July 6, 2015 jury trial date which is granted by the court.
All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15,  in Room 502SB.
The state informs the court that there is outstanding discovery as to all 3 cases concerning telephones and computers.
State will be filing a motion to consolidate all cases (15CF1536, 15CF2493, 15CF2675) to be heard on final pretrial date.  The state is requesting that the court include in the NO CONTACT ORDER that the defendant may have contact with his wife, Rebecca K, only through his counsel, Atty Smith and the family attorney, which is ordered by the court.
Case set for final pretrial on 8-12-2015 at 8:30am.  Jury trial set for 8-24-2015 at 8:30am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 7-21-2015. 
  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defense Motion to Adjourn Jury Trial date filed.

Attorney Jonathan Carver Smith in court, defendant Daniel R Kram not in court, in custody in Ozaukee County.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests to vacate currently scheduled trial date, as new charges have been filed against the defendant.   Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 38. Case remains calendared for jury trial on 7/6/15 at 8:15 in Br. 38.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Daniel R Kram in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State has requested that the court modify conditions of no contact order as to defendant.  Statement to the court by Rebecca K.
Based on statements to the court and information provided by the state the court will modify no contact order to include:
NO UNSUPERVISED contact with children under the age of 18 years(including minor daughter)
NO social media use, all accounts are to be closed out
ABSOLUTE NO CONTACT with alleged victim
RETURN all keys for the home and for 2 cars (2002 Honda Accord and 2014 Toyota Highlander)
The court informs wife that financial issues must be addressed by Family Court.

Defendant Daniel R Kram in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has a new case pending, 15CF2493, that is set for preliminary hearing on 6-18-2015 at 1:30pm.  Parties request another final pretrial after that date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Daniel R Kram in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Jonathan Smith informs the court that a bail review is not necessary as the defendant has posted bail.  Bail hearing of 4-15-2015 is cancelled.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MDK (8/23/98) OR SRF (2/15/98).

Defendant Daniel R Kram in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Defendant Daniel R Kram in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WAGNER, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  NO PLEAS ENTERED FOR MISDEMEANOR COUNTS 4 & 5.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   

Court orders DNA sample to be taken.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 166.77(4).

  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
